barbed_wire.title: Barbed Wire
barbed_wire.description: Fencing wire constructed with sharp edges or points arranged at intervals along the strands.

bars.title: Vertical Bars
bars.description: A fence made of (usually metal) bars.

chain_link.title: Chain-Link
chain_link.description: A woven fence usually made from galvanized or polyethylene-coated steel wire.

electric.title: Electric
electric.description: A fence that uses electric shocks to prevent animals or people from crossing a boundary.

pailing.title: Pailing
pailing.description: A variety of fences, usually consisting of either vertical posts tied together with wire, or vertical boards nailed to horizontal braces.

panel.title: Panels
panel.description: A fence made of prefabricated panels that are inserted into grooves in concrete (or wooden) fence posts.

pole.title: Poles
pole.description: A fence mainly made only out of poles.

post_and_rail.title: Post-And-Rail
post_and_rail.description: A variety of fences usually made of horizontal rails on top of vertical, or sometimes slanted, posts.

railing.title: Railing
railing.description: A railing for example at the edge of a bridge to prevent persons or vehicles from falling down. Often made of metal or wood.

roundpole.title: Roundpole
roundpole.description: A wooden fence typical of Finland, Sweden, Norway and Estonia. It is normally made from debarked unsplit youngish trees.

slatted.title: Slatted Boards
slatted.description: A fence made of wooden or concrete upright posts, with usually three horizontal wooden rails, to which vertical wooden boards are fastened.

split_rail.title: Spit-Rail
split_rail.description: A fence constructed out of timber logs, usually split lengthwise into rails.

wire.title: Wire
wire.description: A variety of fences mainly made of wire; e.g. welded vertical wires, horizontal wires strung through or between posts, wire mesh.
